title: day 3 1/2 months
content:
From Tech Visionary to Coding Founder: My 100-Day Journey
After years as a technology visionary with zero coding experience, I found myself at a crossroads 3½ months ago. When my original partner declined to invest alongside me to hire a developer for SharedStars—someone who had successfully built multiple projects for me before—I faced a familiar chorus from friends and family:
"Mark, we don't see anything tangible beyond fancy PowerPoint slides."
That was the moment I decided: "Enough is enough."
I committed to learning coding through AI assistance and building our MVP myself. Fast forward to today, and we're approaching completion with sophisticated logic, including our custom STELLA AI system that actually learns from user interactions to provide increasingly effective training and guidance for our astronaut trainees.
This journey hasn't been without challenges. I've been largely working solo, aside from collaborating with two developers from India whom I met via Upwork (which, candidly, has been more of a financial drain than expected).
What's remarkable is how much can be accomplished with determination and the right AI tools. I've found Claude AI (by Anthropic) to be exceptionally helpful—far superior to alternatives for my development needs. After seven intensive hours today, I finally completed a properly formatted page that matches our design specifications.
This is just the beginning of sharing my founder's journey. I look forward to documenting our progress, challenges, and the innovative ways we're using AI to build SharedStars—making space exploration training accessible to all.
— Mark Sendo, Founder. PS b/c i spelll horibly, i even used AI to help rewrite this blog post
